Pre-Game Insights: India and Afghanistan are set to play their first bilateral white-ball series, with the first T20I scheduled for January 11, 2024, in Mohali.
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are back in India's T20I squad for the first time since the 2022 T20 World Cup, but Kohli will miss the first game due to personal reasons.
Rahul Dravid has confirmed that Rohit Sharma and Yashasvi Jaiswal are India's first-choice openers in T20Is.
Shubman Gill could slot in at No. 3 in Kohli's absence for the first game, but may have to sit out for the last two games.
Afghanistan will be keen to build on their gains from the 2023 ODI World Cup, playing nine T20Is between now and the T20 World Cup.
Rashid Khan is not part of the Afghanistan squad due to back surgery, with Ibrahim Zadran expected to lead the side once again.
Others: This is the first time India are playing a bilateral white-ball series against Afghanistan.
